definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: Night, He Junfeng sneaked into the office building, found the document.
sentences.chinese: 夜裏，賀俊峯偷偷溜進辦公樓裏，找到了那份文件。

sentences.english: Hongye Rubber Factory set-occupied and rental office as a whole.
sentences.chinese: 宏業橡膠廠辦公樓集自用和出租爲一體。

sentences.english: But today, kind of at that end is a great big high-rise office block.
sentences.chinese: 但是現在，集市那頭是一個很大的高層辦公樓。

sentences.english: Office Building of Century Group is situated at the junction of Xingang Road and the 3rd Street downtown Tanggu.
sentences.chinese: 世紀集團辦公樓地處塘沽中心區新港路與三號路交口。

sentences.english: In this paper, the demolition of an office building with controlled blasting is briefly introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了原北京帶鋼廠辦公樓的控制爆破拆除。

sentences.english: New office buildings have encroached on the school grounds.
sentences.chinese: 新辦公樓蠶食了學校的操場。

sentences.english: While delegates went into the government building the crowd remained standing outside the door.
sentences.chinese: 他們派代表進入辦公樓，其餘羣衆都站在門外等侯。

sentences.english: If you’re in an office building and can’t get out, don’t panic.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在辦公樓出不去，千萬別驚慌。

sentences.english: The newly-built building is our office building。
sentences.chinese: 這座新建的大樓是我們的辦公樓。

sentences.english: The lack of steel, building what side a side B is finalized .
sentences.chinese: 由於缺乏鋼性規定，辦公樓究竟孰甲孰乙難有定論。

sentences.english: My company bought an old building, gave it a face-lift, and converted it to offices.
sentences.chinese: 我的公司購置了一幢舊房，整修後將它變成了辦公樓。

sentences.english: The new office block is an excrescence on the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 這座新辦公樓在這片風景中很礙眼。

sentences.english: Big office buildings and apartment complexes sit half-finished.
sentences.chinese: 大的辦公樓和公寓羣都成了爛尾樓。

sentences.english: White's office is located on the road, a number of well- head water fountain outside.
sentences.chinese: 辦公樓所在的白龍路上，多處地下水井口向外噴水。

sentences.english: LOCATE】Where shall we locate our new office?
sentences.chinese: 我們的新辦公樓將設於何處？

sentences.english: The pictures shows the new office building view inside and outside.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲馬裏總統府辦公樓外景和內景。

definition: building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
shopping mall/shopping center/department store/emporium/CL:家[jia1]/the business world
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
a building used as a factory/factory (building)/CL:座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
